sentences.chinese: 片片原野融化了我的心臟。

sentences.english: For the first time, I felt like I was running into the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次感到自己正在朝着原野方向奔跑。

sentences.english: The huts darkled away into the gloom of the field.
sentences.chinese: 那些茅舍逐漸變模糊，融入了一片蒼茫的原野中。

sentences.english: At this time, there is a goddess Nu Wa, in this vast wilderness walking.
sentences.chinese: 這時，有一位女神女媧，在這莽莽的原野上行走。

sentences.english: A huge tent was extended over the field.
sentences.chinese: 一頂大帳篷在原野上擴展開來。

sentences.english: The old Hulan River flows gently on an autumn morning.
sentences.chinese: 秋日的清晨，古老的呼蘭河水流過原野。

sentences.english: Derricks are scattered here and there on the boundless plain.
sentences.chinese: 在一望無際的原野上散佈着一座座井架。

sentences.english: These artists loved painting the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 這些畫家喜歡畫莽莽原野。

sentences.english: Within a few days, green sprouts push up through the soil and produce a green flush of grass.
sentences.chinese: 幾天內，草兒破土而出，一下子就綠了原野。

sentences.english: On the vast fields, one sees nothing but the wheat billowing in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 在遼闊的原野上，但見麥浪隨風起伏。

sentences.english: Happiness is the prairie in spring, seeing a spring idea full of life, the butterfly dances.
sentences.chinese: 幸福是在春天的原野，看春意盎然，蝶舞翩躚。

sentences.english: These mountains and plains are a cradle and a stepping-stone.
sentences.chinese: 這些高山和原野是搖籃，也是踏腳石。

sentences.english: In the field a lamb was bleating for its mother.
sentences.chinese: 在原野上一隻小羊羔咩咩叫媽。

sentences.english: In fields where the yellow grass grows knee-high.
We bivouacked on the open plain.
sentences.chinese: 我們在開闊的原野上露營。

sentences.english: Low-lying bushes dot yellow and grey fields.
sentences.chinese: 一團團的低的灌木點綴着黃灰色的原野。

definition: to stretch as far as the eye can see (idiom)
as far as the eye can see (idiom)
